basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ I'm Adnan Mohamud, a recent graduate of the University of Washington, where I earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Informatics with a concentration in Human-Computer Interaction. With a strong foundation in coding acquired through my coursework, I am eager to reintegrate myself into the world of software development. Driven by a profound passion for the field, I have always sought to contribute to innovative solutions and cutting-edge advancements. As I embark on this new phase of my professional journey, I am thrilled to be part of this class, as it provides a unique opportunity for me to broaden my skill set and stay ahead of industry trends.

projects.title: Cookie Stand
projects.description: In my project portfolio, I took the initiative to create and oversee the cookie-stand repository on GitHub. I leveraged JavaScript to develop Sales Data and homepage pages, allowing for the dynamic generation and display of simulated sales data across various shop locations. Additionally, I devoted attention to designing a visually captivating homepage, incorporating custom fonts, colors, and layout choices that met strict accessibility standards.

projects.title: Odd Duck
projects.description: I created a web app for Odd Duck Product Co to showcase three products and collect user votes. I took charge of implementing the tracking functionality, ensuring accurate counting of product displays and clicks. Additionally, I designed a polished and user-friendly interface that provided a seamless voting experience and presented the results in a visually appealing manner at the end of each voting round.

projects.title: Glad Gaming
projects.description: This app is a Rock Paper Scissors game with a leaderboard that saves data after each round, and an About Us page. The gameplay will feature multiple opponents with different strategies and gambits, the goal is to get the most wins within a certain number of rounds, and then win against the highest number of opponents in a row.
